{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2964558,"name":"Evan Fish","username":"Mr_Fishy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mr_fishy/{size}/159093_2.png","created_at":"2021-08-07T20:58:41.203Z","cooked":"

As of this last year, the designers and mentors of Team 2471 decided to try switching to using Onshape from Inventor because of its collaborative abilities during quarantine. As we found how useful FeatureScripts were, I decided to learn myself and try to make some scripts that are more focused on what our design team valued in design.

  • Shaft Generator
    We decided to make our own shaft gen because we found that while Julia’s shaft gen was very useful we found that having hole callouts in drawings was a must. So I’ve made my own version that is simplified and doesn’t quite do as much, but it does have hole callouts which makes drawings much faster.

  • Bearing Generator
    The idea of the bearing gen is to make the process of getting a bearing into the part studio much faster than importing it from a file or MKCad. I designed the bearing gen to be able to generate any VEXPro bearing at a given origin, as well as have input values to generate your own bearing if it comes from a different dealer.

  • Belt & Pulley Generator
    One of the main focuses of the belt and pulley gen is to be able to detect whether the center distance was accurate to the belt. While it doesn’t round the belt to a commonly supplied belt, it is much easier to find a working center distance for whatever belt and pulley setup is done. The generator can do HTD5, GT2 2mm, and GT2 3mm belts and pulleys. With multiple options for a bore as well as the flange sizes.

Feel free to suggest any functions or FeatureScripts that would be useful.

Document Link Here: 2471 FeatureScripts

Update - I’ve also made a new lightening feature that uses line selections to create the ribs rather than having to create sections of the sketch to select faces. Another feature I’ve worked on is a variable feature that can create variables based on certain measurements of lines or planes. As well as it can make a variable for chain sprocket center distance or belt pulley center distance.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2021-09-23T18:21:34.687Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":504,"readers_count":503,"score":145.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":395434,"topic_slug":"onshape-featurescripts-by-team-2471","display_username":"Evan Fish","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49309,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/onshape-featurescripts-by-team-2471/395434/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3065825,"name":"Evan Fish","username":"Mr_Fishy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mr_fishy/{size}/159093_2.png","created_at":"2022-05-27T02:37:11.423Z","cooked":"

New Major Updates!

Shaft Generator

  • Now has the center holes! Allows for any standard hole via the Onshape hole tables, as well as creates the callout like the standard hole feature!
  • Has new 3D spacer options such as the Universal Hex Profile, as well as Vex Spline.

Bearing Generator

  • Now has the ability to input part numbers for custom bearings.

Lightening Feature

  • Generates ribs via line selections OR arc selections
  • Has face exclusions when generating a lightening profile
  • Auto repairs sharp edges generated by lightening profile
  • Can merge with multiple parts

Advanced Variables

  • Adds variable functionality that is not available via the current variable feature
  • Measures line/arc lengths, distance between lines, distance between planes, pulley center distance, and chain center distance.

Part Numbering

  • Automatically selects parts without a part number when updated
  • Only adds part numbers to parts that do not already have a part number
  • Has an integrated custom table that shows all part numbers within the part studio

Mr_Fishy:

Bearing Generator

I’m not exactly understanding the reasoning behind this. Why make a new part every time you want a COTS bearing? Doesn’t that crowd the part studio?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2022-05-27T08:14:07.552Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":320,"readers_count":319,"score":79.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":395434,"topic_slug":"onshape-featurescripts-by-team-2471","display_username":"Ari Meles-Braverman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25012,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/onshape-featurescripts-by-team-2471/395434/5","custom_user_title":"FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3066033,"name":"Evan Fish","username":"Mr_Fishy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mr_fishy/{size}/159093_2.png","created_at":"2022-05-27T23:31:54.976Z","cooked":"

Yes and no, how you use any feature that generates a new part is up to you, but now you can have a COT bearing directly added that is regenerative, compared to a assembly reference or imported part. The main positive of the Bearing Generator is it allows you to easily generate custom bearings with the same information that any imported or generated bearing will have (dimensions, steel material, and part number). I personally find the Bearing Generator much easier and more efficient to use rather than importing and transforming a bearing that may be needed in a part studio as well (its also much faster generation time).

I just published a new version of the 2471 FeatureScripts document!

This entails the new addition of the PolyBelt Generator.

image1992×1158 196 KB

  • Generates complex polycord belts given pulley locations and diameter parameters.
  • Flat belts will be held off for further development, but round cord belts are fully functional.

Of course, if there is any bugs, questions, or improvement suggestions, then please let me know.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2022-10-10T08:33:25.325Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":19,"reads":223,"readers_count":222,"score":289.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":395434,"topic_slug":"onshape-featurescripts-by-team-2471","display_username":"Evan Fish","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/b/4/b4605c6cb31b57a1f84d81bc234b82f85889a1b3.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49309,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/onshape-featurescripts-by-team-2471/395434/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":8,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3117083,"name":"Evan Fish","username":"Mr_Fishy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mr_fishy/{size}/159093_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-06T04:20:40.378Z","cooked":"

Here is one last update before the 2023 season kicks off! This update was focused on preparing the Belt & Pulley Generator for the season featuring:

  • Updated tooth generation for pulleys to the same accuracy as mkCAD.
  • Improved center to center distance check to the same quality as West Coast Products calculator.
  • Belts are now automatically rounded to the nearest tooth count by intervals of 5 as most COT belts in FRC are, but this can also be easily disabled in the UI.
  • Improved “Fit Adjustment” processing.
  • Reworked origin computations, as well as “Single Pulley” generation only requires one origin selection.
  • Fixed offsets generated by different flange width’s.
  • Fixed situational extrusion bugs.
  • Changed center distance report to display in inches.

image969×56 7.98 KB

image384×936 41.3 KB

Before tooth profile corrections:

image944×1262 111 KB

After tooth profile corrections:

image1214×1251 109 KB

As always, if there are any bugs or improvement suggestions, feel free to message me!
Link to Onshape document: 2471 FeatureScripts
